title: Clade
summary: A clade (from Ancient Greek  κλάδος (kládos) 'branch'), also known as a monophyletic group or natural group,[1] is a group of organisms that are monophyletic – that is, composed of a common ancestor and all its lineal descendants - on a phylogenetic tree.[2] Rather than the English term, the equivalent Latin term cladus (plural cladi) is often used in taxonomical literature.
